conversationText: [$A: Yonder the stars befitting this nightly soul. Might and wonder follow suit yet no companion have I., $B: I toil till morningsdale to sit at the table of my fellow men when daybreaks., $A: So I have spotted your fiery blade. Come then, herohero, let us journey forth together.]
partyQuestRoadPoemPrompts: [$An ice heart oft shears fiery tears.$The clerksmen of heaven must be unconcerned to us.$Being here, basking under this sun together...it's quite nice.]
partyQuestOptionReplies: [$We are one in this thought.$Thunder bolt with your house!$Yes, yet it is only one of many possibilities.$And why not?]
partyQuestRoadPoemPlayerOptions: [$Thine words share the same spit as mine.$Marlarkey!$Tis' a possibility.$Nay.$I agree.$It is very quiet.]

conversationText: [$A: My companion of yore. Salutations!, $B: Must you be so formal? The springs and trees wonder why thee playeth such a wooden fiddle., $A: Does my noble address bother thee?, $B: Nay, I suppose., $A: Fie! One falters in changing their voice, yet the fates of those who are indeterminate., $B: Do not be troubled - let us resume our adventure at once., $A: At your behest!]
partyQuestRoadPoemPrompts: [$Am oft burned at work. If I disappeareth on a bright moon's night: do not wonder for then I am surely busier than must.$I doth wish I could be a longer presence around my small ones. Yet work I must.$Mine own father's blood wrote a blueprint for my deeds; for what does my blood desireth but to please mine blood?]
partyQuestOptionReplies: [$Such as it is; I wish I had more time, but nature doth cancel men's plans on her own time.$Thee seem to have a great burden of your own, taking you from this strange world. How doth thee not complain at all?$May they forgive me when they grow up.$...$I have harkened such a thing from this adventure with thee: I aim to become who I am to become - onwards!$Yes, well. Perhaps we may discuss this at greater length in another place.]
partyQuestRoadPoemPlayerOptions: [$Work be may as it may be; carry on.$Everyone has a burden to carry.$They must miss their father at times.$Presence is most noticed when gone.$Blood ruleth blood. Who can overcome? Who may become?$Feareth not the instilled powers, but embrace them freely.]

conversationText: [$B: I must believe it is time that we set our motion forward., $A: I concur., $B:  Let us meet in Chat Homes 3D later. I will add you to my list of present friends., $A: Tis' life that one must account for temporality in matters of friendship. I do wish our endeavor to share temporality be not miffed by the past or future., $B: I wish as well, my friend., $A: Yet for now, farewell., $B: Farewell.]
[$B: Who may role play with me? I shall be known henceforth as the lord of fire.$A: I have never considered role play necessary, but you intrigue me. $B: Will you be my new support?]
partyQuestRoadPoemPrompts: [$I am a worker of the law in the other world. What is thy business?$What kind of office?]
partyQuestOptionReplies: [$I see.$No trouble.$Your spells are effective.$Most interesting.]
partyQuestRoadPoemPlayerOptions: [$I am work in an office.$I cannot say.$Let us set our attention to the task at hand.$Mine is an office of regulation.]

conversationText: [$B: I'd like to know why this game even exists. Convince me to stay. Anybody?, $A: Plenty of loot., $B: And?, $B: Maybe if I could make companions on this lonely journey., $A: The scarlet cardinal may yet turn blue under the right moonlight., $B: If it were so, I must have been hiding under the direst rock., $A: Tis' never too late. Turn the stone now, and live. Let us walk as brothers.]
partyQuestRoadPoemPrompts: [$I have lost a friend recently. We have quarrelled and lost our sense.$I must admit that it has been many seasons, and I would like us to talk again.$And thee? Hath thee someone waiting on your mercy?]
partyQuestOptionReplies: [$Unless he made the first amend, nay. I will not lurch beneath my station to his satisfaction.$Perhaps it is easy for you to say.$I will try.$I know.$Then you are lucky.$Good luck.]
partyQuestRoadPoemPlayerOptions: [$Doth thy desire reconciliation?$There is no sense in waiting for pride.$Then take courage and let it be.$Tis' no easy feat. $I have nobody.$I cannot say. Have I done my deeds correctly so far?]

conversationText: [$B: I must offer thee sincere recognition for the previous day., $A: My line of work has taught me that men yearn to help each other. Yet they are conned by the weight of their possessions, and so they must walk like drunkards do., $B: You have shown me how to smile again. Let us be companions in Chat Homes 3D.]
